definition: full of sap (idiom); young and vigorous
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

square/power or involution (math.)/upright/honest/fair and square/direction/side/party (to a contract, dispute etc)/place/method/prescription (medicine)/just when/only or just/classifier for square things/abbr. for square or cubic meter

sentences.english: They are more courageous than older men and their hot temper prevents fear.
sentences.chinese: 比起老年人来，他们血气方刚，热情使他们毫无畏惧。

sentences.english: But everything here calls for solitude and the blood of young men.
sentences.chinese: 但在这里的每样事物都召唤孤独和血气方刚的年轻人。

to be in the prime of life
smell of mother's milk not yet dried (idiom); immature and inexperienced/still wet behind the ears
not to know the immensity of heaven and earth/an exaggerated opinion of one's own abilities

definition: to stop at nothing (idiom)/to dare to do anything
still possessing the innocence of childhood (idiom)
venturing from one's thatched hut for the first time (idiom)/young and inexperienced/novice/greenhorn
